title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 October 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:28 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
00:46 <jvelo> "Usual Spambots won't execute JavaScript"  
00:47 <jvelo> I don't think that's necessarily true  
00:49 <polx> has quit  
01:00 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:03 <@cjd> it's not that they can't, just I think most spammers are not even thinking about much more than a bash script with a curl call  
01:03 <@cjd> even just requiring the csrf token means they need 2 curl calls  
01:04 <@cjd> doubling the effort for a lot of spammers

11:50 <cdop> Question: wysiwyg-Editmode: I want to select some text and by pressing one button i would like to have it formatted either into python or java-highlighter, not using the macro-button-dialog-insert-method. Pssobile?  
11:50 <cdop> erm possible?  
11:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

16:26 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:51 <cdop> ok: I added "undo" and "redo" and "|" to the wysiwyg-menubar and now i cant configure it no more? The elements and "add" is gone. what i want to archieve is to use \*only\* the menubar (or toolbar) tu use less space for the editor.  
16:54 <+mflorea> cdop: you cannot put any feature on the menu bar. Only a few plugins provide menus and menu items. So you need to revert the menu bar configuration. What you can do is to display only the toolbar  
16:56 <cdop> Ok, how to revert it? edit xwiki.cfg? and may i put the "links" button/plugin into the toolbar?  
16:56 <+mflorea> wait, why xwiki.cfg?  
16:56 <cdop> (thx for the fast answer btw)  
16:56 <cdop> well see here: http://weltenspiegel.de/private/xwiki/wysiwygcfg.png  
16:57 <+mflorea> ok, easy, the configuration displayed there is stored in XWiki.WysiwygEditorConfig page  
16:58 <+mflorea> you can simply rollback to one of its previous versions  
17:00 <cdop> oh, cant find that page... tried http://10.0.0.179:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?text=wysiwyg  
17:02 <+mflorea> you can use the Jump To Page feature, Gtrl/Meta + G and then type XWiki.WysiwygEditorConfig, you'll get suggestions  
17:02 <+mflorea> but you can also write the URL directly in the address bar, .../xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/WysiwygEditorConfig  
17:04 <cdop> Ok, only got one HistoryEntry though... should i delete it?  
17:04 <cdop> "1.6 Administrator 2012/10/11 16:47 Imported from XAR Current version Delete"  
17:04 <+mflorea> no, click show minor versions  
17:04 <+mflorea> you have only one major version  
17:05 <+mflorea> and by default only major versions are displayed  
17:06 <cdop> Ah, got it, thanks! Menubar is back and kicking, thankt  
17:07 <+mflorea> great. What you can do now is to uncheck "Show source tab" to hide the Source/WYSIWYG tags above the editor (you won't be able to see the source though, unless you switch to wiki edit mode) and you can also remove all the menu items to hide the menu  
17:08 <polx> has quit  
17:09 <+mflorea> unfortunately not all features can be put on the tool bar.. see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor#HPluginsandFeatures for the list  
17:10 <cdop> oh, i see, so 2 bars is inevitable, but thanks for the last link!  
17:10 <+mflorea> as for your first question, you can put a macro shortcut on the toolbar ( http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor#HAddan27InsertHTMLmacro27buttononthetoolbar ) but it won't take the currently selected text  
17:12 <cdop> yeah, just read about the "macro"-toolbar-button, i guess thats what i will be using a lot then :)  
17:13 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
17:13 <cdop> this XE is very customizable, nice design, guys!!!!  
17:14 <sburjan> has quit  
17:16 <jvdrean> has quit
